intro: Hibbertia emarginata, commonly known as the emarginate hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red anthers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions of Western Australia. Hibbertia emarginata has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid environments.
